title: Exclusive: Agustin Pichot fights for Tier Two nations' progression to secure World Cup legacy
text:
World Rugby vice-chairman, Agustín Pichot, fears the legacy of Rugby World Cup 2019 will be wasted if countries like Japan are not admitted to annual competitions such as the Rugby Championship or given more games against Tier One countries. Pichot, the former Pumas scrum-half, led the fight for Argentina to be included in Super Rugby as well as the Rugby Championship and now wants to see Japan accorded similar status.

“If we don’t find a solution on the calendar for the likes of Japan within the next year, then the legacy will be wasted,” said Pichot who also wants to see greater recognition for teams such as Uruguay and Namibia and Fiji. “It is all about the growth of our game. What do we want...
